intro: Dickinsia, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to South America, particularly in regions of Chile and Argentina. They are characterized by their compact, low-growing form and are often found in rocky or coastal environments. Dickinsia species typically have small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white or pale blue petals. Their ability to thrive in harsh conditions makes them an important part of their native ecosystems.
